title: Great place to work
pros: Great atmosphere friendly people always busy
cons: Quantity over quality need more people crossed trained

title: Mediocrity At Its Best
pros: My co-workers were good people to be around. There was room for growth early on. Tuition reimbursement option is a plus for students.
cons: Leadership has no vision. Leadership cares not about the culture or morale of the employees. Workload is not equivalent to the pay unless you are VP or above, and then the paradigm shifts in the other direction. Appreciation is only communicated in a halfhearted verbal method, and never interprets into pay increases or other benefits. "Merit Increase" program is actually an annual across-the-board cost of living increase. No matter how much merit you bring to the table, you will often see the same increase as some of your lazier and less-motivated counterparts. The Human Resources team is a toxic group with multiple agendas and unchecked power. They are very intrusive, manipulative and controlling. I worked for Americold for more than 5 years, and built tons of good personal relationships - NO ONE LIKES THEIR JOB. I have never heard anyone brag on this company, or defend it when someone else bashes it. The shame of it all is that Americold has the resources and funds to be the absolute best company in the industry, but no one wants to take the time to creatively motivate, incentivize or appreciate the people doing the legwork.

title: Disorganized, poorly managed and behind the times
pros: -Decent pay -Relatively flat management structure -Free parking
cons: -Bare minimum amount of PTO that doesn't roll over if unused. Also only observes the bare minimum of holidays -Terrible health benefits. Expensive, extremely high deductible and very limited in coverage -Americold itself is an amalgamation of a bunch of warehouses and smaller storage firms which were acquired and mashed together by a private equity firm. This has led to understandable growing pains, confusion and inefficiency -The warehouses themselves only started keeping real records a few years ago, so there is NO reliable data available before 2013 or so -The data the company does get is both incomplete and unreliable, though management seems content to act based on bad information -Middle management is aloof and doesn't seem to care about the goings on among regular employees -An overly aggressive HR department makes an already conflict-rich environment even more contentious -Constant turnover among all levels of the hierarchy has left people uneasy. Most everyone has an "exit strategy" -Management is unreceptive to suggestions and complaints -People are fired seemingly at random

title: Management sucks

cons: Could never get any help from higher ups wanted everything fixed but didn’t want to spend money on parts

title: Average company with alot of transitional turnover
pros: Because of the high turnover rate there is always an oportunity to start on 3rd shift and move to first or second shift. Hourly employees have good benefits as far as paid time off and the ability to work over - time to compensate for the mediocre wage. Health care is good for what you contribute each month.
cons: As a supervisor you are salaried 50 hours a week, this equates to less than an houlry wage of the people you are supervising. Because the headquarters are in Atlanta, I don't feel the company values trickle down to the facilities. Alot of focus is given on customer service, which is great for job security, but the employees are not recognized for the sacrifice. Unless you have obtained a network of friends within the company, you are left on the outside looking in. It is hard to understand what direction the company is headed when people in upper management are coming and going.

pros: Not very many pros I guess
cons: It was just ok very unorganized

title: Good Place to work
pros: Good Place to work. You work hard, you become successful
cons: Will allow you to over load yourself

title: Good
pros: Good people, good benefits, good times
cons: No cons to really note

title: The best
pros: Good place to work forsure
cons: To many rules no doubt

title: Stay far away from this company
pros: There are zero pros to working for this company.
cons: No leadership. No training, you have to try to figure it out. If you’re in any supervisor or manager position, they expect you to work from 5am to 10-11pm with no additional compensation. They have a revolving door of temporary workers so they don’t have to invest in hiring anyone. Absolutely terrible employee treatment. Upper management will yell at anyone in front of other staff. Front line employees are treated as expendable and replaceable. Sexual harassment investigations are not followed through with HR, they claim they investigate it but take no action when multiple people are filing claims against the same person. Women are treated as gophers and expected to cater to General Managers on any whim they may have. If you try to take a day off, you are harassed by management and told you are not a “team player”. Then they will call you multiple times on your day off and tell you that you have to come in, or you will get fired - even if you’ve stated that you have consumed alcohol and cannot drive. Personal and confidential employee information is easily accessible, often times it’s left in folders around the office or just thrown in the trash can with no shredding. There is no long term plan for anything. I could go on and on but this is the most toxic work environment I have encountered in 20+ years of working.

title: Disrespect
pros: Lots of OT. As a selector, its a physically challenging work place. Most employees loose 20-30lbs within a few months.
cons: There are too many cons to list, so here's my top three. One can easily hurt themselves in this environment. Slips, trips, and falls are common. The organization lacks the man power to keep the floors clean. Ice cubes are everywhere, and one single ice cube can take you out permanently. Broken open boxes of food are everywhere, and everything is frozen, adding to slipping hazards. The equipment (pallet jacks) operate poorly, forcing you to strain when steering. There incentive program allows employees to make $4.00 an hour more if they exceed the formulated performance level by 35%, in other words, working at a rate equal to 135% effective. Mathematically, the extra 35% effort is rewarded at less than the starting wage. The company benefits greatly by paying an incentive vs. OT Finally, after injuring my back, I found the company's HR department completely disregard all my emails, phone calls, and requests to further investigate my particular circumstances. Fairness and Openness are two of the company's core values. In my opinion, they completely disregarded these values.

title: Low pay
pros: No way. Need better pay
cons: Customer systems are always down

pros: not many pros working here
cons: lots of cons working here

title: No headline is adequate
pros: I loved this job. The work was easy for me. The guys were great, my supervisors were cool, the pay was above average. Pro/Con-Definitely a "MacGyver" environment.
cons: Somewhere along the line before I signed on there was a decision to not allow mechanics to have tools to fix the machines, then after a few months of complaining we were handed 3 wrenches (no exaggeration). Also it could be months before parts would show up to fix a broken machine but you were expected to keep it running. The "inside" joke was the place was held together by chewing gum and band-aids. I have no idea how they stay in business but no lie, I would work for them again. I only left because they went to 12hr shifts. I signed on with them for the 8hr shifts.

title: Very production oriented
pros: Occasionally got free product. Very independent work. Company provided freezer suit. Computer system worked well compared to similar systems I've seen.
cons: Did not train on forklift or equipment, pretty much threw us to the wolves after watching safety videos and about 4 hours of training. Not enough Pallet jacks for everyone so people that never got any training would end up picking with a reach truck. Half of the pallet jacks didn't work right which was a safety hazard Not anywhere near enough training for the job position Warehouse was very dirty lots of debris in the forklift lanes could pose a safety hazard. Was very hard to track down a supervisor if you had an emergency Very long shifts, typically 12 hours with 2 to 4 hours of forced overtime on top of that, normally got between 55 and 70 hours a week. Have to submit your time cards to two different systems to get paid. Work in a freezer from anywhere from -34 degrees up to 29 degrees I got hired on as a forklift driver and never even touched a forklift while I was there. Mostly stacking crates of yogurt.

title: It's a job
pros: Good hours, not consistent. It's better than being in the blazing heat of the summer.
cons: Management is rooted deeper than a Sequoia Tree, favoritism runs heavy, seniority is all they care about, but get paid the same after a year of working there as the guys 20+ They do some shady stuff regarding your schedules, not communicating with those new hires the actual policy they are informing, more of a "there are the rules cause I say so"

title: Very stressful and seniority rules in everything
pros: The hourly is good and they have ok health insurance
cons: Employed full time and work part time hours management changes rules every other day and low seniority employees get the worst work schedule and you can be kick out of your job position in a shift bid even if you are more skilled they don't care seniority rules the company if you are a LTO you will be stressed to the max they want you to load ,receive, and case pick all in one good stepping stone job

title: Americold Overview
pros: Americold is a BIG company. 10k+ employees, 140+ locations. Blue collar jobs, white collar jobs. The options are endless. As a corporate employee I enjoy the seemingly endless supply of new projects, frequent travel all over the country and occasionally overseas. The compensation is industry standard maybe a tad below. Flexibility is gaining popularity. The people who make up the company are overwhelmingly great people with very few bad apples. You only like your job as much as your current boss so if you are not happy it is pretty easy to change but it is up to you. Americold ultimately is what you make out of it for yourself. The options are endless and your level of effort goes a long way in determining your future.
cons: Workflow, decision making processes, direction can do a 180 quickly. The only constant at Americold is change! But as long as you know what you are getting into it should not be that shocking.

title: Corporate Employee
pros: Americold is a great company to work for. They value your input and welcome creativity and innovation. I've been here for almost a year and I love it! The pay is good, employees are friendly, and they believe in promoting from within. If you are looking for a company that offers career growth and a rewarding future, look no further! Don't believe the negative reviews, unfortunately Americold isn't exempt from disgruntled former employees.
cons: I wish we had more paid holidays like the day off after Thanksgiving and Christmas Eve. Other than that I really don't have any cons.

title: CA$H4GRASS program, contact your local water company for details.
pros: I had a lot of fun there Sups on the floor are cool and the checks are on time. It's close to home. That's all I got.
cons: The pay is not right for what is expected. The Union is very weak because of no participation by the members. A lot of butt kissers, back stabbers and job scared coworkers. Upper management is clueless and treat you like an inmate. It's cold but if you take a few Norco and Soma every couple hours it's doable. Smoking a bowl before work and at lunch makes it easier to put up with all the stupidshit. Got to keep a G-pen and wax handy to hit in the freezer for when they call OT. Favoritism is out of control.

title: Incompetence, rude. Painfully slow, horrible computer system
pros: Can't think of anything good to say about this facility. Especially since that horrible poor excuse for a computer system was installed
cons: As a truck driver, this is my shipping facility. I arrive, check in always one hour ahead of my dock appointment. NEVER is my load ready. Most of the time it's not even picked. On average, I will spend 6-8 hours here waiting to get loaded . It wasn't too terribly bad before his farce of a new computer system was installed. Now if you can actually get an employee who can work the computers, provided they're working, it can still take 20 minutes to check in, get told to go to driver waiting,EVENTUALLY you'll get a door in rail dock, wait another hour and half, finally get loaded, go park AGAIN, go wait in line AGAIN for another incompetent boob to figure out the paper work. The old c o computer system all you had to do was sign in the rail dock office, they'd print your papers and you were out.

title: Great People Horrible Management
pros: Hard working people that want to work. Overtime is always available. Pay is okay but it is a cold environment so it could be better.
cons: Upper management only cares about themselves. They blame supervisors for everything and force them to come in early and stay late and work on their days off. All of this while taking way the extra pay supervisor used to get for working when they were supposed to be off. Schedule is always over booked and management forces supervisors to mandate associates to work over almost every day because they can't manage the customer. Management never takes responsibility for their actions and always blames someone else. Management even tries to set up people to get them into trouble. Management tells supervisors one thing and then tells associates another thing and it is all a lie to save their jobs. This is one of the worst managed places I have ever worked!

title: A Growing company for motivated people
pros: As a Supervisor, you motivate people to do the work for you. 1st shift has a great team atmosphere. You get to work in a freezer all day long. The Operations Manager travels, so it leaves time to improvise on working conditions. You can advance in the company by attending outside company functions. I started as a lift truck operator and advanced from a second shift supervisor to first shift supervisor, by being a best man at my managers wedding.
cons: You work in a freezer all day. You ask your local Human Resources about employee benefits and you are told to call an 1-800 number. Health care is offered, at a great cost to employees. Small crew so when someone is gone you pick up extra work. A lot of turn over due to management at site level.

title: All for one
pros: None. Any skills and methods you meant here will be as outdated as the machines the need to constantly fix.
cons: -Poor management. "Management" does not mean "delegation". Be prepated to do your boss's work for her. -Poor communication. The staff is great at keeping details to themselves until they receive word from their superiors that this information needs to be shared. -Hostile work environment. The senior staff is only concerned about themselves. The females of the office will do little for their male coworkers, as the all female crew prefer to keep it that way. -Lack of training. Most of what I learned from was self taught. -Poor work/life balance. You will not have a personal life. -False propoganda. Management will try so hard to project a positive outward example. However that face should be the same behind closed doors. Never will you be treated as an equal.

title: Stressful but rewarding
pros: Advancement opportunities are there for those whom are willing to put in the extra effort to attain their goals. This is a recession-proof industry, we store and ship food product....people have to eat.
cons: Longevity within the company has too much pull. More focus should be placed on education and what a person brings to the table, rather than how long they have worked for the company.

title: Good Company, Poor Employer
pros: Paychecks don't bounce. Never have to worry about getting in hours.
cons: Company is not family friendly. Family problem? They just don't care. Poor management makes it difficult to have a life outside warehouse. The one I just resigned from is making their employees work 12-hour shifts, and often two extra shifts per week - around 65 + hours per week. The mandated overtime is relentless because their only plan is to make their employees work more and more hours. Have a horrible time retaining new employees. They have about a 90% turnover rate after new employees reach their 30-day mark and start getting all those mandated overtime hours.

title: The cycle of work
pros: Pay can be competitive but it took a while for them to budge and increase...afterwards wage increase are on merit.
cons: Workload is overwhelming. They push you to do more which is good to a certain extent. It seems they never want to hire more because of budget and MOSTLY because of corporate. A person can only do so much in a day. Working OT all year around is exhausting. Yeah maybe you get week here and there where you dont work as much OT but its never enough. Its a hole that you cant dig yourself out of.

title: A lot of talk with little movement forward.
pros: Plenty of work (OT), Know the work enviorment everyday, Company is trying to move forward with current management. Making changes in the right direction. Is looking for new ways to grow the buisness, working international markets as well as domestic.
cons: They tend to give up on projects if they don't return the dollars fast enough. They need to let thngs mature more before giving up and changing gears.Most warehouse have the attitude that if you don't do what they want they will go away. Some GMs are afraid to speak up due to past management. Quite a few people are afraid of change both old timers and new employees.

title: Treating People Poorly is Bad Business
pros: Exercise. Most warehouse workers ("pickers") will perform hundreds to well over one thousand lifting motions per shift.
cons: Work/life balance? Hard to have work/life balance when you don't have a life. Be there every time the company says—your scheduled time off, Christmas Eve, whenever—or be fired. Who knew indentured-servitude was still a valid employment model for 21st century America? Americold has experienced multiple on-the-job fatalities in the last three years, yet working conditions still barely rise to the level of sweat shop . . . with personnel policies to match. All the company seems to know is blunt-force coercion: if treating people poorly doesn't work, we'll treat them worse.

title: There needs to be more balance, care and respect!
pros: Time off paid day 1
cons: Insurance cost is outrageous, no balance of family and work, last minute on the fly expect you to stay for overtime when you have prior obligations but if you do not stay you get wrote up and points. Cold work environment for not so much pay. Upper management doesn't seem to have as much heart as teammates and team leads and supervisors.

title: Bosses are cool but other employees aren't
pros: The money was ok for the type of work it is. And after awhile there is growth opportunities. Benefits are pretty good too
cons: My coworkers on graveyard were childish and they were grown men in their 40's or 50's. They would talk about you and make sure you heard it and pretend like they care about helping you while being very condescending. Shift lead wouldn't listen to anything i said and yelled at me because he didnt believe the equipment wasnt working and thought i was not using it right (next day got called in the office so i could get new equipment because the old one didnt work which is what i tried to tell the shift lead but it was making him angry). Shift lead would also make rude comments about me to other coworkers.

title: Old school leadership.
pros: Location okay, pay average, benefits average.
cons: Americold is currently undergoing an abrupt transition in customer service thus causing mass confusion within the customer support teams, customers, warehouses and management. To make matters even worse - the computer systems are slow and unresponsive at critical times causing low productivity. The mission statement discourages micromanagement however that is exactly what has happen. By creating a quality control team of ex-supervisors to monitor, critic phone and grade email messages to the ninth degree while under this transition. Account reps are under enormous stress to learn new accounts (50+ each), warehouses, SOP's, new computer systems - which are still in the roll out phase and mounting programming issues - thus causing extremely low morale and lack of trust in leadership. Lay-offs are frequent and turnover is high.

title: Single worst employer I have ever worked for
pros: The employees are great people. Everyone gets along well.
cons: Very harsh punnishments for simple things. The attendance policy is rediculous. (work in a freezer and can only miss or be one minute late 6 days in a year)The list of work rules is a mile long and the punnishments are not fitting. Performance expectations are way out of line. (three bad days in a year can get you fired) The Management runs amuck with favoritism. Every supervisor has their own set of rules making it impossible to know exactly what is expected. The eguipment is not maintained well at all. Employees are expected to use equipment that doesn't work right and has safety issues and still maintain their performance. In a nut shell, the employees are just a number to management.

title: Company in Transition
pros: Americold is an old company that has gone through many transformations. Most of those have been fraught with problems. However, today is a new Americold. The current management team has been in place for three years now and has made tremendous progress re-shapping the company. There is still work to do but Americold has reclaimed it's position overall as being the best provider in the industry.
cons: The recent transformation has been demanding. Lot's of hours and lot's of turnover. That said, it is important to find the right team in every functional area and the vast majority of turn has been good turn.

title: Full Time Employee
pros: Well, It is a job, ..a pay check , that is really about the only thing good to say about being here. So,If you need a job They will hire anyone with a heartbeat.
cons: They will hire anyone and throw them on a lift , work release is O.K. , but they don't tell you if violent offenders are working with you.( they say they run background checks but lots of felons have worked here for years). its a very old building, old equipment , worn out fork lifts and doors, angry " mean" Local management .. ridiculous goals and no rewards, favoritism of certain crew , and a severe shift rivalry . poor wages for this area ....... not sure how some of they guys have kept their job for 10 years ?" teachers pets " very very high turnover rate.

title: Worst place to work at
pros: Literally nothing good about working here, not even the paychecks bc they pay so little
cons: Everything, literally everything, from the terrible pay to the roaches to everything

title: Overall good!
pros: I initially received some negative feedback from a former Americold employee about the department that wanted to hire me. I'm glad I didn't listen. What I will say is be smart enough to assess the situation yourself. The team I work for has been great. There are plenty of learning opportunities and the company at the corp office really values investing in the team. I've taken on lots of work responsibilities. My director is great about making sure we celebrate during holidays and birthdays. The company has 1 or 2 corporate events at year.
cons: Work/life balance is tough. At corp in certain departments, it seems like the company keeps you at capacity. It takes a while for promotion opportunities and increases are pretty standard. The PTO isn't the best. No real wfh policy, it's left up to your direct manager.

title: Average pay, terrible work life balance.
pros: 4 10 hr day's when mandatory overtime isn't required.
cons: Punished for missing work even with a Dr's note, negative atmosphere, quanity over quality with almost impossible work quotas to meet. Set up that way so it is impossible to draw unemployment from them. Political just like every other job.

title: So So company
pros: The Appleton facility has great management and the co-workers are awesome. All in all it is a great atmosphere to work in as the majority of the employees get along great. They also have a great vacation policy for their employees.
cons: As with any large corporation they seem to think that everyone is replaceable even if they have a great employee right there. You don't necessarily get paid what you are worth because of that and the corporate offices don't seem to get that. They also don't always put the customers needs or interests first. If a major customer is happy with the way things are and the systems you use, why change them and risk losing that major customer? Some decisions don't always make the most sense.

title: Great company!
pros: Americold is a great company to work for! There is much to be done and employees are given the right support and training to get work done. Work smarter and not harder is a very prevalent theme across the company, which makes life better for people with respect to work/life balance.
cons: Perhaps the only con to Americold is that it is still going through some growing pains and the focus on continuous improvement is making it less overwhelming.

title: I love it here
pros: Tom Stevens is an outstanding General Manager. He has taken the initiative to ensure our site is running efficiently and effectively. Tom has brought new ideas and innovations to our company, which have resulted in increased productivity and profitability. He is an excellent communicator and has excellent problem-solving skills. He is always available to answer any questions or address any issues in a timely manner. We could not be happier that Tom is our new General Manager. He is a refreshing change from our old General Manager and has far exceeded our expectations.
cons: Our site provides an extremely efficient operation and excellent service to our customers. This means that we are consistently at our storage capacity. Which can lead to occasionally working long hours.

title: Americold
pros: I can work a much overtime as I want, can't work past 12 hrs tho and I can come in at anytime on my off days. Most of the work is done on a High Reach so there's nothing physical about the work unless you get a case pick. Theres double time. No mandatory overtime till until you've worked 90 days.
cons: Its a freezer position so even with the gear you start with you will need to layer up. Its unionized so starting out you're at the bottom of the seniority totem pole witch means you will always be the first to get hit with mandatory ovt. You can only get double time after working 48 hrs and having 6 punch-ins or six days worked.

title: Tenured employee who has advanced in many roles. AWESOME Co-Workers!!
pros: Strong market presence. Leadership has shared vision. People in this industry are incredibly great. Advancement opportunities are there but you have to work for them. Great company for people with a strong work ethic.
cons: This industry historically has not necessarily been structured in a true corporate fashion. Growing in that process can be frustrating and make decisions or projects take longer than needed thus outdating important items for our customer or facility. That said, it is a needed change and in the long run is what will set Americold apart from everyone else. I am sure our executive team shares in this frustration.

title: Not sure where they’re going.
pros: Good hours and days. Flexible management. Love that management recognizes employees birthdays and anniversaries. Goodness cold weather gear and boots. Enjoy vacation time and holidays off.
cons: Hurry up and wait attitude at regional/corporate. Scared to take chances. Won’t spend much needed money to fix deteriorating buildings, ammonia refrigeration systems, and equipment (which could potentially lead to a major safety issue). Loss of several key corporate and regional higher-up employees. It shows they can’t keep talented people around due to the frustration of the company being poorly run. Also, stop keeping some of these terrible employees just because you’re scared of being sued! Focus on the talent and move them up.

title: Sanitation is okay but not great.
pros: Union representation Excellent coworkers Friendly and awesome supervisors Safety bonuses Safety Committee Security Gates w/cardkey
cons: Union - Seniority Based Union - four months to get in for Sanitation. Can be cold in winter months, very hot in summer months. Dress accordingly! If you're in the freezer area dress warm. And no steel toes! Composite toes only.

title: Great job/Great Atmosphere Unfortunate pay for employees
pros: The Edison location is a great place to work. The atmosphere is exemplary. The associates are great and the immediate management team is top tier. There’s freedom to do your work and not be micro managed.
cons: Unfortunately the biggest downside is the pay. It’s almost disheartening to know and feel that you aren’t being compensated well enough for the amount of work you out in on a daily basis. For such a large company it should be easy to pay their associates a competitive wage. You are almost required to work at least 10-12 hours of overtime a week just to see a decent check.

title: A Job that leaves you frozen
pros: Steady money with overtime seems to be the norm throught each location. If you're lucky to work with a good crew, it can go smoothly. Large company achieved through merger/aquisitions.
cons: New CEO every 3 yrs each bringing a new project, thus many projects never complete. Benefits seem to always decrease or become more expensive while you're given a "we care" speech. Maintenance on equipment is at the end of priority. OT is usually mandatory. somewhat aggresive productivity enforced in non-union plant morale is too low for this extreme environment

title: Hard, Frustrating, Dangerous, Isolating
pros: They pay on time. The work is great exercise! Don't need to worry about the AC in the summer.
cons: It's -10f all the time. Equipment breaks down at the worst time, every time. Lack of time for family. Poor management of people and time. Stressful micro management and performance tracking based on unrealistic timing. Problems are addressed too little too late. People die either on the job, or from heart attacks thinking about the job. Don't expect to live over 60.

title: Corporate is a Joke
pros: none none none none
cons: Human Resources at Corporate is a joke. They do nothing to help their employees, instead they work directly with management. In many cases management has no clue how to do their job or their employees. HR upholds this behavior and rewards this, while the employees who are managers or below get nothing. If you report something to HR, please know that it will get right back to your manager. Management runs the company not HR. Use Americold as a stepping stone, not to advance your career but to move on to a better "employee" based company. Managers and above get away with anything including holding back their employees.

title: Some Good Co-workers....that's about it
pros: Some of the people I worked with for the most part were decent.
cons: 2 "supervisors" were horrid, 2 of them were OK. Why should people have to deal with 4-5 different supervisors each week? Incentive provides for an unsafe work environment and they (mngmnt) complain about lack of safety. Blatant racism (it is VA though so I expect that) amongst co-workers. Never know how many hours will be worked sometimes 10-12 hour days and sometimes 4-5!! I only took the job because I was desperate and at the time it didn't seem horrible but as you know hindsight blah blah.. Although the hourly pay was above average for Strasburg standards it still wasn't enough considering the hazards involved. Equipment was junk...all of it.

title: Trying but too many politics
pros: Top level management seems to be trying to direct the Company in the right direction by efforts to improve communication and excellence practices.
cons: Too many politics. Top level management is kept 'up to date' on half truths by corporate management team. Mid level corporate management does not do a good job in bridging the reality of what happens at site level to executives There's a 'buddy' system in which Corporate personnel looks out for their own interests and are not effectively bridging the gap between executives and sites.

title: Operations Supervisor
pros: Money and benefits are decent. Job security as long as you are halfway skilled. Company has potential to be one of the best.
cons: Terrible atmosphere. Managers and supervisors have been with the company for up to 25 years. No new blood or ideas. You have to make your own quality of life. Americold will pay you enough that you can't find another job to match your salary and take advantage of you knowing you probably won't leave.

title: Ignorant management
pros: There use to be plenty, now not so much. Pay....
cons: Can't move up in the company. Consistently hiring outside and having to deal with new management making bad decisions and bringing their people in and putting them in higher positions than someone who has been there for over 20 yes, which makes it look like people are being pushed out. Losing company money and running off customers. Just check the longevity of management in PA and see for yourself. Your numbers are more important than safety, quality and production and profit. GM shouldn't drive around with beer in his truck. It's not a good look.

title: Human Resources - Corporate
pros: HR finally decided to pay hourly associates for days that the office was closed for bad weather. We no longer have to use our vacation when the building is closed!
cons: It almost feels like we have more HR people now than regular employees and no one really knows what they do. The company is no better today than it was 3 years ago. The only difference is they will now fire you for no reason. There is no room for growth and the meritt increases are not even enough to buy a can of coke.

title: Fair job but beware the new-hire prohibition
pros: A decent job as far as warehouse jobs go. Nothing outstanding but fair. Rather decent pay and reliable hours. Best if you've done this kind of warehouse work before, with walkie-rider pallet jacks and whatnot.
cons: Unfortunately, I was let go during the 90-day new-hire probation, after I got sick (COVID-related) and took too many days off. Got let go by their third-party management company who does all the hiring and firing. Be sure you can devote yourself to that 90-day new-hire period.

title: Order Selector
pros: Great pay 17.18 and the incentives up to 32.80 an hour. The pace and physical labor keeps u in shape. NICE benefit discounts on almost everything. Humble and social co workers. It a great place to make money and save up. They company supply u with freezer gear and PPE. The days go by quick, you get paid every week. LOTS of overtime..
cons: Freezer temp is -20 the ice cream room is -40 hard to keep your feet warm sometimes. You have to work on your days off most weeks. Seniority get the early out everyday. Some days would be harder to make rate from the exhausted previous days.

title: I do not advise working for these people
pros: Pay is just below par for this area in this industry.
cons: Management tends to be selected from members and prospective members of a 'good old boys' network. Caustic work environment is encouraged; the management style tends to lead toward dehumanization and intimidation. Management staff will to refer to hourly employees in terms as 'inmates,' and by less polite derogations. Certain hourly employees seem to have little other function than to single out, deride, and intimidate other employees. Rampant, and at times despicable, kid pro quo abuses by management staff toward hourly employees.

title: Operations Manager
pros: The pay was decent, slightly above market average for title. Atlanta offers many locations to allow associates to transfer for better work hours or closer to home.
cons: I was amazed at the volume of emails generated daily. Poor communication within the facility ranks. I was surprised at the amount of "clerical" work expected from the management team. I spent 2-3 hours a day entering data into various portals. Had little chance to utilize "management skills" and bring ideas to the table. The work hours expected definitely did not honor a "work/life" balance. Upper management continuously looking for opportunities to drive the "wedge" between supervisors and union workforce. High management turnover, beware before accepting an offer.

title: Worst job in my entire profession in warehousing
pros: One positive benefits was the weekly pay and at times I had three consecutive days off
cons: The hours were grueling (from 4pm-2am sometimes 3:30am), the laborious work did not match the pay rate, and there was very little breaks. Lunch was only a half hour for 10-hour shifts for crying out loud! Very minimal contact with peers; disliked that tremendously. Performance based work that will only advance you if you meet their demands with orders which was an overkill at times.

title: Business Development Manager
pros: The details of the job as it was explained to me was exactly what the job entailed. The support and training I received was great. They give clear expectations of what they are looking for you to do and support that with onboard training and continued training. They make it easy to ask questions and help get you the correct information you are looking for.
cons: Some processes could be improved upon, but at least they are always looking at better ways of doing things and your opinion matters.

title: Great company but very impersonal
pros: Made it through three years. Great people to work with within a department. You wear a lot of hats and learn alot about the industry because of it.
cons: Every year around March there will be layoffs only to have more people hired by the end of the year at lower pay of course. Lot's of room for improvement but stuck in the "this is the way we've always done it." Worked 50 - 60 hours a week. It was expected but not recognized nor appreciated.

title: Great time to join Americold!
pros: I recently joined Americold and think that it couldn't be a better time to join the organization. The company has a good deal of structure and direction in place, but there is still a lot of room for individuals to identify opportunities for further improvement so that they can leave their mark on the business.
cons: I haven't been able to identify any yet. The company seems stable and appears to be heading in the right direction in terms of growth and profitability.

title: Great people and career opportunities!
pros: My co-workers are very talented! Plus I have the opportunity to learn something every day and I fee like my contributions make a difference for others and the company. Since I've been with the company for several years, I can really see the difference now that we have a good executive team --- they are engaged and leading/driving a true culture change.
cons: Continue to work on improving communication - at all levels. This doesn't seem to be unique to Americold -- I think lots of companies have to work on this aspect.

title: Horrible Company!!!
pros: You make a decent hourly wage and you get insurance.
cons: (Phoenix Location) Management acts like bullies and favor the ones they are close and personal friends with. One of the most unprofessional companies I have ever worked for! They micro manage just about every little thing you do and punish you to no end with constant write-ups and suspensions. Hard work definitely goes unnoticed there and like I said if you want to excel with this company you need to have been managements 1) family members or 2 )high school buddies. They talk about policy and rules that you have to follow but ultimately they constantly are breaking the rules with their unfair and unruly treatment.....I would not recommend this company even to my worst enemy, unless you like working your butt off in a freezer box for peanuts. Just saying

title: Great benefits, but low pay. Unstable demand.
pros: Competitive health benefits, good trainers from senior employees. Good direct line supervisors.
cons: Low hourly wage. Work is seasonal so that even full time employees may find themselves with a rescinded job. Union structure ensures that newhires get the least desirable shifts and progression comes by a vacating senior employee- not by performance. At Lynden facility, there is a fish company operating out of a warehouse who's culture is less concerned about safety and which presents a dangerous work environment. Aging facilities. If you get hurt, they'll work to terminate you before it becomes an L and I case.

title: Stressful
pros: Decent Pay, Benefits good, Facility Level management good
cons: Operations is king, The facility services side of our company is overworked,and undervalued. no corporate support, if you ask for support you get more work thrown on you. Left hand doesn't know what the right is doing.

title: It's been a challenging one. I'm determined to make my goals and work as much overtime as possible, however, I already can tell that this is going to get old extremely fast so...good luck making your numbers, and its a good job for folks with criminal records, so apply away. It seems like everyone that works there has record so that's stereotype.
pros: Overtime and pay. Work enough hours and make your incentive marks, salary can go from 28k to 50k easily.
cons: Caffeine and energy drinks is the only to keep your job.

title: Hated one day they decided that the Dock Clerks position was not important to the success of the company.
pros: If you don't mind the hours and work there is money that can be made.
cons: Upper level really needs to understand the different positions within the facility before deciding to cut certain positions. Sometimes upper level has no clue on the importance of certain positions or the connection to success of the company as a whole.

title: Commercial Paralegal
pros: This is an established company that continues to grow in the industry, I believe. The people I work with and have met from other departments are very nice. They seem to like their positions.
cons: I've only been here for a couple of months, but I have a lot of cons. First, the work area where I am situated is right in front of the copier (Legal, 5th FL, corporate office, ATL, GA). Therefore, it is noisy when the printer is being used, people are in and out and talk REALLY LOUD as if I am not there. If I am taking a conf. call or trying to concentrate, it makes for a hard time. I've asked for a better spot, but no results yet. Secondly, I wasn't aware until my orientation day that the PTO is only 2 weeks, to include vacation AND sick time/personal time. I would expect that if PTO vs Vacation/sick time, the company would provide 15 days (3 weeks) at a minimum. There is not work life balance when an employee cant use at least one full week of vacation (deducting sick time, dr. appts, etc, there's not much left). Lastly, they need to increase the number of company holidays. For ex, the day after Thanksgiving, Christmas eve, MLK (which is a national holiday so not sure why we aren't observing it). Offering the option to tele-commute once a week would also help. Most progressive companies allow this and it enhances employee moral. Most employees I've talked to also share my sentiments.

title: Until 2014 it was a great place to work.
pros: There is opportunity for overtime work.. My compensation was very good after having worked there for 10 years. The benefits were great
cons: A quota system was established this past year. You were expected to make 95% of your quota even when you were working on a job that you were not used to doing.

title: This is one of the worst jobs I have had.
pros: The only good thing about this company is the starting pay is above average. Despite the efforts to elimate overtime, there is an excess in overtime hours.
cons: Very minimal if any at all work life balance. Many associates work up to 10-12 hours or more daily. Also work is mandatory on weekends taking away from personal family time.

title: Old business, old ways
pros: -Adequate training for new skills. -Plenty of overtime opportunities.
cons: -Many employees of the office crew are nearing retirement and are too preoccupied with protecting their retirement. Far too much drama festers in this facility. -High turnover rate means that this team is always a skeleton crew. Lots of overtime, whether you want it or not. -The facility is in the airport district of Modesto and has a high crime rate. Many vagrants pestering the front desk team of clerks. -Security has an easy job, yet still manages to find new ways to be lazy and botch their few responsibilities.

title: LTO AMERICOLD
pros: The incentive program is good when it is able to be obtained.
cons: Management will prevent you from earning incentive if you are willing to do other work that does not pay incentive. Then they will make it a trend and you may make much less than you could/should be. They say this work is on a voluntary basis but not when they want you to do it. Be careful of this slippery slope if you do too good a job at the work no one else wants to do.

title: Great place to develop skills in IT
pros: Hours are M-Fri 8-4:30 and flexible if you were recently on call. IT team works great in making sure work is equally divided. Excellent for a up and coming IT Rep. Can be relaxing at times NOT A CALL CENTER
cons: Network can go down during from storms due to a semi old facility. Good news is that we are upgrading to a new facility soon! ON CALL 24-7 if network does go done or emergency. No Upward Mobility Senior Management can be pushy but that is because we are IT.

title: Avoid this company at any price!
pros: Reasonable base pay. Current executive team trying to improve things. Recent upgrade of office space makes time at the office a little more bearable.
cons: There is no work-life balance whatsoever. In some departments working 7 days and being on call during vacations, funerals, Holidays, etc. is mandatory. Many managers have little if any leadership skills and are mediocre managers at best. The company is owned by a private equity firm which aims to squeeze every possible penny out of the company without putting anything back in. It is truly a sweatshop.

title: Americold is a great company and has an outstanding leadership team.
pros: Americold has many great opportunities from a career advancement standpoint, and the Executive Leadership team is highly focused on moving the company forward. The culture is becoming much more focused on people development and accountability, and the management team has recently updated the mission and values.
cons: The company has traditionally operated with a focus on independent sites and has not created a cohesive culture. That being said, the current leadership team is taking some positive steps forward to create a more cohesive culture.

title: Local level
pros: Flexible hours for management. Nice people to work with
cons: No training. You have to figure out their processes and procedures on your own. No training on their software. Very low pay. Way below the industry standard. No incentives to do better for the company. EXTREMELY LOW budgets. Very old equipment to run and operate. The corporate structure are policy pushers. They wont assist you with answers or help

title: Working for Americold
pros: Ok pay , Like most of the people I work with and Like what I do! Everyone gets along with each other , for the most part.
cons: Keep adding new procedures , policies and work without increasing manpower ! Communication from mid management to upper management needs work ,and upper management needs more hands on with all of the facilities. Take a look around ,check the work of the mid management .

title: Great company with bright future!
pros: Americold had provided me with opportunities to grow with many opportunities for promotion. I have been with the company over twenty years and have had many great experiences that have been positive for myself and family. We have had the very positive changes in the past four years with employee engagement and development. Never a better time to work for this company!
cons: Sometimes with the size of the company bad management at the site level happens and it takes time to remove. This can cause bad experiences for our employees.

title: Don’t Waste Your Time
pros: Hours of down time do to them refusing to drop more work. Money was decent. Percs of making more if you were above your percentage and double pay for the weekend
cons: Everything time based they want you to pick over 200 cases of product with in 30 minutes ranging for 50 pounds to 2 pounds. Too congested they want everybody picking in the same area. The point system sets you up for failure they only give you 4 points for the year. Although its 4 on 3 off you literally have to recover the entire 3 days because it’s so much ware and tare on your body. They don’t properly train their temps. If you was sick higher management will try to bully you about the point system into staying

title: It was a great experience working for this company.
pros: For the most part, the environment is great. Then you have people that never want to see another person move forward. The pay is extremely good, the supervisor's and group leaders are the best. Overall one of the best jobs that I have ever worked for.
cons: It's very cold, and if you work on the weekend shift, it sucks because you had to stay as long as it took to get the product out.

title: Mediocre company....but trying.
pros: Compensation for me was quite good. Upper management is trying to change the culture in a positive manner and ewcognizes some of the past mistakes made by previous regimes...
cons: This is a company entrenched with an internal good old boy network which will never change. For all practical purposes the accounting department runs the company (and not necessarily in a good way). HR is useless....

title: Stop the lies
pros: The only Pros to this company is that it's a paycheck.
cons: Management here sucks. A bunch of smart dummies that try to tell people that's been here for years how to do their jobs when they can't do it or even their own jobs as managers. We change operations managers and general managers yearly. The company is poorly managed and whoever on here is giving good reviews is doing so from upper management trying to make this crap look good. How can the company be successfully managed when 95 percent of the employees want to quit and hate their job? It's a paycheck and that's it. Ever heard the saying a cold day in h..l? Welcome to Americold!

title: Straight up honest unbiased from an employee
pros: Hours are available, pay and incentives if you can achieve them but its up to you, training is thorough, employees focused on their jobs.
cons: Pulling quota is hard to meet. Extremely physical and mental.

title: Broken promises
pros: The hours are great.
cons: Very dirty breakroom. Only 1 employee bathroom for up to 70 people of both sexes. Can get fired on a points system really easy. Pay is good for some that have very little responsibility but doesnt go up for those with lots of responsibility. Too much drama with the employees.

title: Good Wages, Difficult Relationship
pros: Good pay, it's really easy to get along with your fellow employees. Many are willing to help you and everybody else.
cons: Just get ready for very long work hours. Many of the employees don't mind working the extra hours, but get extremely tired after 16 straight hours of work. You don't get much family time.

title: They lie to you and expect you to be everyone's mother
pros: Good pay Alright benefits Free lunch every once in a while
cons: They lie to you and expect you to be everyone's mother and pick up after grown adults and they don't pick up after themselves because of the rate and because of that rate the lughead truck operators(LTO'S)act like idiots to achieve thier rate blow through freezer doors without stopping or honking the floor is a joke first shift shoves cardboard in the compactor so tight it takes 30 minutes to clear it out so the next person can use it in conclusion most of the people are decent but the others are just idiots. VERY UNSAFE PLACE TO WORK!!!

title: Great place to work
pros: The company is in a recession proof business and is growing. They invest a lot of money training and developing management. The company wants to improve relationships with front line workers and there is large focus on employee engagement. Also focused on Safety
cons: Takes a while for new employees to understand the Americold way . Corporate demands a lot from the field which makes work unnecessarily complex.

title: A safety nightmare
pros: Good pay, good benefits and diverse. About 90 Hispanic, a little of everything else on the floor. Unsure of the make up of middle and upper management.
cons: Safety is almost non existent, many days you do not have the equipment needed to perform your job, extream cold conditions with not enough warm up time, someone gets injured almost daily. Training is almost non existent.

title: What a joke
pros: You get to work 10 hours a day and about an hour before you go home you get to look at a board to see your stuck there for another hour or two. dont go get a drink in the break room if your not on break youll get written up this place is a joke anyone willing to put up with this place for more then a month or two just to get on your feet needs help. if it wasnt for the union this place wouldnt even exist.
cons: Dont even bother going to this place for a job the bad outweighs the good by far.

title: A little good, a little bad
pros: Good pay at corporate, but I hear that has changed in the last year. There are some great people there. The industry is recession proof and they are a recognized leader in the market.
cons: A lot of politics between functions. Change is slow and difficult. Much work is dependent on a very weak IT department.

title: long hours, horrible management..FAVORITISM
pros: pay rate, thats about it
cons: cannot balance home life with this job, never know how many OT hours you will work until middle of shift....always changing policies, especially call off and pto time...if you question anything you get a target on your back....they HATE their employees.........safety is spoken of, but NEVER followed through....the roofs leaks in our warehouse and causes ice spots everywhere.....maintenance dept is not qualified and never fixes anything or does duct tape fixes.....upper management is greedy and selfish...force employees with more seniority to do things the new butt kissers don't have too....some supervisors are ok and work with you, others are complete idiots and butt kissers

title: Knowing the value a company puts in it's employees:
pros: The facility was a union shop. The company was the largest in their industry in the world.
cons: Management staff turned over like people change their socks. The separation between employees and upper management. My facility was closed, and when we were let go no severance package offered at all to say thanks for years of service. The type of work was quite physical and often in freezer like temperatures.

title: Company in a hypergrowth phase
pros: The company is in a hyper-growth phase, with a lot of learning opportunities, and great people. Some of the existing staff have been with the company for generations and these people are the strength of this company.
cons: Internal talent is passed over external hires. The current state is in disarray with a lot of critical talent leaving the company. Staff is thinly spread over multiple projects in a huge acquisition period and nothing gets done in time.

title: Modern offices, enthusiastic team, plenty to do!
pros: The working environment was recently refurbished so is very modern, especially by logistics standards! Great break rooms and social activities, and very convenient being just off GA400. There's a lot of experience here with a good mix of new employees and long-term experienced people too.
cons: There's certainly plenty to do and it can mean long days. Presentation development skills are a must

title: Deppends on who you are how you are treated
pros: Salery is ok and some of the coworkers are good people to work with
cons: You will only move up in the company if you suck on managements balls and snitch on other employees.

title: Good Company
pros: We have a clear vision and receive monthly updates from our CEO! This carries down and we have constant communication with our RVP's and Directors of Operations. We have over 150 locations, so there is a lot of room to grow and build a long term career here at Americold. Different departments and facilities work well together. Someone is always available and willing to help.
cons: We spend a lot of time in sub-zero temperatures.

title: Warehouse worker
pros: Americold is a great place to work. Family type environment with raises every 6 months. .77 cents to be exact. I would recommend this position to anyone
cons: Working in the freezer is a bit challenging but over time your body gets used to it. Management pushes you to get numbers but it's not that hard to achieve them.

title: ..... smh
pros: Pay was good and you get pto/sick time
cons: Health insurance cost too much and you pay for it every 2 weeks instead of one payment monthly, very late over time posting, progressive discipline done based of emotions or favorites, somethings always be changed, one minute you work 7 12s the next minute there ain’t no overtime available, I could go on for days about this job...

title: Poorly Ran Company!!!
pros: Enjoyed working with some of the people. Paid very well for my position.
cons: I accepted the position as a Black Belt for the company, which was to implement change. The first thing that needed to change was how to sweep the warehouse. This should have been a strong signal that management had no control over its workforce. If you can't keep a clean facility in the food service industry then you probably can't change much else. In the end they downsized the department. Not a good environment for long term employment!!!

title: Horrible Company Period!!
pros: Absolutely none I dread even having to go to work everyday!! I have nothing good to say about this company no matter how hard I try I would just be lying!
cons: Probably one of worst companies I have ever worked for!! Management is a total joke from the top to the bottom. This company has series problems and yet they do absolutely nothing to fix the issues. They ask for input on making processes better, but when you suggest something to them it's either no we can't do that or you get the deer in the headlights look.

title: EMPLOYEE REVIEW
pros: Bonus/Incentive for high productivity, good warehouse management treats us with respect. Clean facility.and new equipment. Good people to work with and management provides rewards and acknowledgement for hard workers.
cons: Growth potential and career opportunities. HR and admin is not available and helpful with questions about benefits and compensation and time off. Everything is on-line, hard to get help with things.

title: good pay bad management
pros: started out easy pay is good benifits are acceptable the hours are very easy to come byincentive that they have leave most pay scale up to you.
cons: management poor they need to get out of the office more and see what happens out on the floor human resources very very bad they look to rotate people out for the slightest infracion

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Excellent and fair leadership at all levels. Truly care about the associates and value their associates. Excellent benefits and PTO policy. Culture is one of transparency and collaboration. Leadership truly appreciate and value the associates. Great HR programs in place to enhance the employee experience. From the CEO to Legal, HR, etc, they are fair and balanced. Again, great leadership and excellent compnay!
cons: Long hours and at times resources are sparse.

title: The worst job to ever work at slave work for people with no experience and to expect to have no future in life
pros: Nothing good the Mangement is fraud they just want to work you tell you break your back it’s like when slaves broke boulders with sludge hammers and when the couldn’t do it anymore they took the sludge hammer and cracked them over the head terrible place to work
cons: Everything is bad most of the workers are racist towards blacks and new workers

title: Horrible Management
pros: Good Pay, Job Culture, PTO, Lounge
cons: Horrible Management Probationary Period Payroll constantly messed up Heavy Workload(300-500 5-50 pound cases per hour)

title: Company could care less about you. Equipment is very old and dangerous. Cold work environment.
pros: Friendly coworkers. Decent pay but for a skilled mechanic you barely make more that the forklift operators.
cons: Benifits are not that great. 4 point attendance policy for entire year. Work in temps 32℉ to -5℉. Only 2 sick days for entire year. 24hrs on call. Very very shorthanded for the amount of work needed to be completed.

title: Warehouse worker
pros: Pay is ok. People that I worked with was great
cons: To much overtime expected out of employees and temp workers. Not alot of home time to see your kids. Management likes to cause chaos amongst wokers. Management need to look at the whole picture and not just one particular shift (day shift, the hours that management work). Seen way to much finger pointing and bullying by management belittling workers infront of other emplyees.

title: Highest corporate turnover I have ever seen!!
pros: The pay was decent and that is the only good thing I have to say.
cons: The culture of Americold is terrible! This company is owned by investors and they could care less about the employees. High level executives have resigned with no other employment lined up due to the bad culture. It my years of working, I have never seen such a high turnover rate in a corporate office.

title: Poor management. Den of Sharks
pros: Working with the teamsters is nice. Well designed union. As an hourly worker the union will take of you even though it is a constant fight with management. Salaries are not bad for the workload however the schedules are constantly changing and upper management is taking away all perks like lunch breaks.
cons: This company is a den of sharks. Poor work/life balance. Upper management pits front-line managers against each other and against hourly workers. HR is instructed to mis-inform during interviews amd the hiring process

title: Americold puts its people second and treats hourly associaties poorly.
pros: Stable industry. Company has been around many years.
cons: Too much focus on profits over people. They want to write up hourly associates for everything. Reactionary in everything and never proactive. Focus on pencil whipping things that don't matter and don't focus on actual actions that do matter.

title: At least it's not C&S
pros: If you like the cold, this is the place to go. There are Americold locaitons almost everywhere.
cons: Very few non-union sites. The environment is very 'machine like, in so much as it churns and churns and spits out people like debris.

title: No corporate support
pros: Good people to work with at the local level, some educational opportunities exist through tuition reimbursement and intranet training
cons: Lip service is paid to work/life balance, but if you're phone is not on you 24/7 (and answered 24/7) you're screwed. Continuously growing demands from upper management with no proper support or mentoring accompanying them. Too much centralization of business functions combined with poor performance from various departments at corporate headquarters; too much bureaucracy.

title: Site Management is very easy to get along with and are very results oriented.
pros: Americold Logistics is a wonderful company. Competitive salaries and good benefits including 401K with a 3% company match. A generous Paid Time Off (PTO) Policy allows employees to call out two days per year without being subject to the Attendance Policy.
cons: Must be content with not advancing to a higher level since opportunites for advancement are rare at the site level. I am fine with this.

title: A cold day in...
pros: Over-time, steady work hours, compensation is ok.
cons: poor leadership, poor organization, compensation could be better, company values do not match management values, work-life balance

pros: Good LTO workers and money is good if you want to work and have 0 lives .
cons: EVERYTHING !! Management doesnt care what you think . People sleeping in office . Management all they talk about is football and where they wanna go eat for lunch. Dirty !!!! Lots of drama every night . all they do is care about lines / hour and don't give a crap about -: quality - workers . There is 0000 core values and integrity .... PERIOD !!

pros: Diverse experience and the opportunity to promote. Continue education is supported. Paid Time off accrues from date of hire and available for use. Americold believes in promoting from within.
cons: Continuous improvement is not always backed up with the training and or the tools to support especially when promoting from within or promoting from and hourly associate to a salaried associate.

title: No room for growth
pros: There a few people there that are genuine.
cons: There is not room for growth at this company. Once you are in a position there is a "heads down and do your work mentality". There is also a bit of a ageism, I am a younger and while I worked there I felt like I was both treated and spoken too like I was inferior to my co-workers. There was a strong lack of respect in the department that I worked in.

title: Picking orders from an head site that told us where an location.
pros: Order Puller, Wrapper, and Stage.
cons: Well the only downside of working for AmeriCold on Nestle side. Was working in a - 40 degrees freezer. Cus its was to cold and not get enough time to unfreeze ur body.

title: "Ok" place to work
pros: The benefits you get for insurance through the union is great. Under $100 a paycheck to insure your whole family. The pay is pretty decent. There's no shortage of overtime if you want to work it.
cons: Management, communication, co workers who don't care about doing a good job or just their job in general, lack of support, lack of training, accountability, shift preference, long hours.

title: Receiving Administrator
pros: Easy job. Excellent benefits. Great for entry level.
cons: Department does not work as a team. Hostile environment at times. Unprofessional coworkers. No room for advancement. No work/life balance.

title: Very unorganized
pros: Good things about this company: Decent wages Decent benefits Most of the people are nice to work with Lots of opportunity to move to different positions
cons: Bad things about this company: Way too much "red tape" Too many changes - policies change too often Top heavy - lots of VPs at the Corporate office - no one knows what most of them do

title: Terrible
pros: The pay was pretty good.
cons: Very unorganized. The freezer was filthy. A bunch of frozen food all over the floors under pallets. It’s a mess. A lot of drama there too. People sleeping with one another. A bunch of drug dealers and stoners. If your a woman working there be careful!!! Stay focused as far as doing ur job and going home!

title: title, really?
pros: What I like about this job or find as pros to working for this company would be its Good pay and good benefits.
cons: What I dont like about this job or find as cons to working for this company would be the cold, and it takes awhile to adapt to the job

title: Forklift operator
pros: Layed back. Great atmosphere. Job security if you are willing to do your job. Good pay with 4 raises the first year.
cons: Get little to no training. Very cold a lot of nights. Lots of overtime during busy season. No opportunity for advancement. Not enough equipment.

title: Business Development/Sales
pros: I left a great company in the 3PL space and could not be happier with my choice. They offer great flexibility and the management does everything they can to help you succeed. Team atmosphere with no back stabbing or pitting associates against each other. New leadership team has a great vision for the future.
cons: Training/onboarding for your specific role could be improved, at times it feels like sink or swim with little explanation on work expectations.

title: An okay company to work for.
pros: - Location is easily accessible - Adequate resources give to perform job - Field Personnel are very pleasant to work with
cons: - Ver political climate. You need to suck up to the right people to get ahead - Promotion potential is dependent on who you are buddies with.

title: Good bosses bad hours
pros: Great bosses, good management. Lots of training opportunities and hypothetically, there is room for a lot of upward mobility. Have to be willing to respond at all times.
cons: Poor hours. Absolutely terrible hours. You're a manager so you can't get overtime, but you have to work on call and in the weekends. Average week is 55 hours, bad weeks (probably one a month) break 65 hours.

title: Perseverance will lead the way.
pros: Can be promoted within the company with drive and determination. Decent pay and decent people for the most part.
cons: Hard nose leadership. Needs more morale building efforts. Also needs better insurance and can never make up there damn mind on a schedule. Some of the shops are union cause people feel they need more of a say due to reason listed above.

title: It's a COOL job
pros: Great associates. Good hours every week. Good pay. Benefits are phenomenal. Lists of room for advancement. Essential job and important part of the workforce.
cons: Push you to your limits. EXTREMELY COLD. Old equipment that malfunctions all the time. Not to safe as they like to say they are.

pros: raise every six months for a year and a half. Lots of opportunities to make extra money. Tolerable work even though its cold
cons: Cold, poor management, could use improvement on their policies and guidelines. Would send you to another building to help others work even though they seem to never help your side.

title: Americold gave me the "Cold Shoulder"
pros: Benefits were very very average.
cons: Management more interested in impressing their bosses than caring about their employees.

title: My experience at AmeriCold Logistics was life changing
pros: The pay is awesome along with the fast paced work enviorment.
cons: Some of the challenges working there is trying to stay warm and long hours, but it is very much worth the challenge.

title: Stressful, unhealthy, work environment!
pros: Working in HR gives you a great excuse to fuel a drinking habit. You might even develop a backbone because of how much you get walked on here!
cons: Everything. Working at Americold incites the same feeling as entering a dangerous map in a video game: you hear the ominous music upon entry and immediately have your guard up in case of attack. The HR department is hostile territory. The People who work there are vindictive, conniving, and only interested in their own personal gain. "Teamwork" doesn't apply here, especially if younger than everyone else. Your "Peers" will see you as inferior and take advantage of you. Management, which is full of incompetent and biased individuals, will only look out for their favorites. It doesn't matter how hard you work or how far of the extra mile you go, it's never enough. If the "favorites" are against you, everyone is. Despite complaints and tip line calls, management does NOTHING to fix the problem. You might get the same motivational speech every single time instead... I was denied vacation time for an emergency when literally EVERYONE in the department got approved to use their time for leisure trips. I was forced in at unreasonably early times when they know I work a 2nd job at night. I've been handed large responsibilities that were not part of my job description without any sort of raise or bonus, and was still expected to get it done along with the 20 other things I did daily. Seriously, if you have any self-worth, don't work here. If you don't want to be beaten down every day, don't work here. If you want to be happy, don't work here,

title: Monopoly company
pros: Ability to work at many locations throughout US and abroad
cons: No concern for customers they provide service for. Because of size, the customer just has to deal with crappy service because the opportunity to go to other cold storage is limited. Americold is not good to the employees they acquire thru acquisitions. Many acquired employees making far less than their counterparts hired direct thru company.

title: Horrible
pros: Nothing. There was nothing I liked about working here.
cons: Everything. This is the number one worst place I have worked my entire life. Too cold (obvious) but that was the least of the troubles. The management team was so, so terrible and unprofessional. They would belittle employees and treat them like they are children. God forbid you park your lift to use the restroom for 2 minutes. Or find an inventory error and have to drive out to the inventory (every 20 minutes this happened) to have those guys belittle you as well. The work was horrible. Case pick and full pallet pick all mixed together, from anywhere in the warehouse. Whatever pick you pull up on your screen, you must complete it. No freedom or control whatsoever of inventory or pick orders. You can't chsnge the location of anything in the warehouse. There are some orders where you have to scan each individual case on the full pallet. Sometimes you have to tear apart the entire skid to scan each case so the weight of the cases can be entered into the system. There is an option where you can enter the full weight of the skid manually into the system without having to do all this work, but of course the inventory guys won't let you do it. The other people who worked there were very rude. Probably because their job sucks. Everyone drove their lifts like idiots. There was NO safety involved. They preached safety at the orientation but no where did I see it when I got out to the floor. We had to stand on our forks to pull 40-50lb boxes down from the tops of 8ft tall skids, and do it fast, while freezing cold. The production was BS. The numbers were almost impossible to make without cheating.

title: Good environment, Poor employee development.
pros: understanding and flexible management, competitive pay, decent benefits(better than most).
cons: poor employee development, other than that its was a good place to work. Also take this with a grain of salt, i worked at a small facility where people picked favorites and avoided conflict.

title: Micromanagers and just bad bosses
pros: Work with multiple cross functional groups
cons: Tooooo much work for tooooo little pay. They will work you to the bone and not even say thank you when you are done. HR is the worst and keeps getting worse. I just don’t know how to defend a company that speaks one thing but truly does another. It hasn’t always been this way, since going public the company had went downhill.

title: management is clueless
pros: Pay is decent and steady work
cons: Management has no idea how to do our jobs all they do is read reports. They also do not honor their core values

title: Love My Job
pros: My boss cares about me and my staff. We work hard together as a team and get great results. We are a dedicated facitlity to life isn't too bad here. I have personally been with the company for many years. I have worked my way up from the bottom.
cons: No cons that I can speak of

title: Cold is the key word
pros: Some of your colleagues are nice and fun people.
cons: Pay is average at best. Difficult to get promotions unless someone retires or quits. Bonuses are very hush hush. Most people don't even know they exist and there is no real consistency behind who gets them regardless of what they say. Leadership is laughable and will try to bully subordinates then brag about it in meetings while simultaneously cowering in the face of any executive. Some people in middle management will smile in your face then speak very negatively of you when they think you're not listening and will directly impede your work efforts if collaboration is needed. No cups in the break room. The workload is unapologetically unreasonable. Most people are working the jobs of an entire team on their own and they are not happy about it. Of course, they begin to lash out and develop poor attitude after being overworked by the company. During the review season, employees are encouraged to not rate themselves too high, making it easier to justify waiting "another year" for a promotion. Continued growth and development is not really supported because they are afraid that employees will grow too much and take your skills elsewhere. A few key people are committing mass exodus due to the place being run so poorly. No sick days. It is mixed with PTO and there is not a lot of it.

title: completely misguided upper management. IT leadership is completely lacking experience
pros: several good people at worker bee level. the GM's seem to know the business well.
cons: this company will be acquired/overhauled in 2-3 years due to lack of senior management strategy. HR policy is to pay in the 50% percentile,,, not a place to go if you have extraordinary skills. it is clear that this is a company in transition, hoping that no one will notice that they're about to hit the wall.

title: No life but good pay for warehousing bc of teamsters
pros: It's a teamsters Union facility so that's a pro and if it wasn't for them the pay would suck and people would be fired let and right.. More so then now.
cons: Lied to by management daily supervisors are the worst ever and forced to drive unsafe equipment just to get quotas that aren't attainable anyway.

title: Toxic Workplace and an HR Nightmare
pros: Hardworking people. But not much of anything positive to share.
cons: HR, middle management, and upper management at the plant are incompetent, unprofessional, and lack empathy and people skills to properly lead a healthy and positive work culture. Good luck trying to use your earned PTO while being interrogated with questions on what you are using your PTO for (it's no one's business). Using sick hours is almost impossible since you get bullied for pretending to be "sick" when it is apparent. How this is sanitary and safe for a food storage facility is beyond me.
